contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox lake |lake_name = Lake Morat <br>Lac de Morat |image_lake = Lac_de_Morat_2003-05-04.jpg |location = [[Canton of Fribourg]]/[[Vaud]] |caption_lake = |image_bathymetry = |caption_bathymetry = |coords = {{coord|46|56|N|7|5|E|type:waterbody_region:CH|display=inline,title}} |type = |inflow = [[Broye]] |outflow = [[Broye]] canal |catchment = 693 km² |basin_countries = Switzerland |length = 8.2 km |width = 2.8 km |area = 22.8 km² |depth = |max-depth = 45 m |volume = 0.55 km³ |residence_time = 1.6 years |shore = |elevation = 429 m |islands = La Grande Ile (islet) |cities = [[Murten|Morat]] }} '''Lake Morat<ref>Cf. Office fédéral de la topographie.</ref>''' ([[French language|French]]: ''Lac de Morat'' (official name); [[German language|German]]: ''Murtensee'') is a [[lake]] located in the cantons of [[Canton of Fribourg|Fribourg]] and [[Vaud]] in the west of [[Switzerland]]. It is named after the small town of [[Murten|Murten/Morat]] on its southern shore. Its official name in [[switzerland]] is "Lake Morat".<ref>Cf. Office fédéral suisse de la topographie.</ref> It is the smallest of the three lakes in the [[Seeland (Switzerland)|Seeland or Pays des trois lacs]] area of the [[Swiss plateau]] located at the foot of the first chain of the [[Jura mountains]]. The main tributary is the river [[Broye]]. Since the [[Jura water correction]] its water leaves the lake through the [[Broye|Broye Canal]] (''Canal de la Broye'') into nearby [[Lake Neuchâtel]] that is connected to [[Lake Biel|Lake Bienne]] through the [[Thielle|canal de la Thielle]]. Thus all three lakes form a natural [[reservoir]] in order to retain overflow water from the river [[Aar]] that flows into Lake Bienne: in times of combined heavy rainfalls and [[glacier]] [[Meltwater|melting]] in the [[Alps]], the peculiar situation arises that the water flows backwards through the Thielle and Broye canals, preventing an overflow of the [[Grand Marais, Seeland|Grand Marais]]. [[File:Karte Murtensee fr.png|none|400px|Lac de Morat]] ==Notes== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline}} *{{HDS|8660}} *[http://www.hydrodaten.admin.ch/en/2004.html#aktuelle_daten Waterlevels of Lake Morat] at [[Murten|Morat]] {{Lakes of Switzerland}} [[Category:Lakes of Switzerland|Murten]] [[Category:Lakes of Vaud]] [[Category:Lakes in the canton of Fribourg]] [[Category:Aar drainage basin]] [[Category:Fribourg–Vaud border]]
